item.title: How can I fix my skillcape emotes?
item.dc:creator: @ezzi ezzi
item.description:
@ezzi wrote:

So I would need 474 gfx becausse im looking in my clickingButtons.java and I think it uses the old gfx for skillcapes

if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerCape] == 9753 || c.playerEquipment[c.playerCape] == 10641 || c.playerEquipment[c.playerCape] == 9754) { //Defence

                    c.gfx0(824);

                    c.startAnimation(4961);

                }

thats one of them

item.title: How can I fix my skillcape emotes?
item.dc:creator: @ezzi ezzi
item.description:
@ezzi wrote:

When I do a Skillcape emote in Pi I get this:

View My Video
If you dont want to look at the video here is a screen shot.

10di169.jpg753×542

My skillcape codes look like this in clickingButtons.java and playerAssistant.java

[code=javascript] public boolean wearingCape(int cape) {
int capes[] = {
9747, 9748, 9750, 9751,
9753, 9754, 9756, 9757,
9759, 9760, 9762, 9763,
9765, 9766, 9768, 9769,
9771, 9772, 9774, 9775,
9777, 9778, 9780, 9781,
9783, 9784, 9786, 9787,
9789, 9790, 9792, 9793,
9795, 9796, 9798, 9799,
9801, 9802, 9804, 9805,
9807, 9808, 9810, 9811,
9813
};
for(int i = 0; i < capes.length; i++) {
if(capes[i] == cape) {
return true;
}
}
return false;
}

public int skillcapeGfx(int cape) {
	int capeGfx[][] = {
		{9747, 823}, {9748, 823},
		{9750, 828}, {9751, 828},
		{9753, 824}, {9754, 824},
		{9756, 832}, {9757, 832},
		{9759, 829}, {9760, 829},
		{9762, 813}, {9763, 813},
		{9765, 817}, {9766, 817},
		{9768, 833}, {9769, 833},
		{9771, 830}, {9772, 830},
		{9774, 835}, {9775, 835},
		{9777, 826}, {9778, 826},
		{9780, 818}, {9781, 818},
		{9783, 812}, {9784, 812},
		//{9786, 819}, {9787, 823}, Slayer
		{9789, 820}, {9790, 820},
		{9792, 814}, {9793, 814},
		{9795, 815}, {9796, 815},
		{9798, 819}, {9799, 819},
		{9801, 821}, {9802, 821},
		{9804, 831}, {9805, 831},
		{9807, 822}, {9808, 822},
		{9810, 825}, {9811, 825},
		{9813, 816}
	};
	for(int i = 0; i < capeGfx.length; i++) {
		if(capeGfx[i][0] == cape) {
			return capeGfx[i][1];
		}
	}
	return -1;
}

public int skillcapeEmote(int cape) {
	int capeEmote[][] = {
		{9747, 4959}, {9748, 4959},
		{9753, 4961}, {9754, 4961},
		{9750, 4981}, {9751, 4981},
		{9756, 4973}, {9757, 4973},
		{9759, 4979}, {9760, 4979},
		{9762, 4939}, {9763, 4939},
		{9765, 4947}, {9766, 4947},
		{9768, 4971}, {9769, 4971},
		{9771, 4977}, {9772, 4977},
		{9774, 4969}, {9775, 4969},
		{9777, 4965}, {9778, 4965},
		{9780, 4949}, {9781, 4949},
		{9783, 4937}, {9784, 4937},
		//{9786, 819}, {9787, 823}, Slayer
		{9789, 4953}, {9790, 4953},
		{9792, 4941}, {9793, 4941},
		{9795, 4943}, {9796, 4943},
		{9798, 4951}, {9799, 4951},
		{9801, 4955}, {9802, 4955},
		{9804, 4975}, {9805, 4975},
		{9807, 4957}, {9808, 4957},
		{9810, 4963}, {9811, 4963},
		{9813, 4945}
	};
	for(int i = 0; i < capeEmote.length; i++) {
		if(capeEmote[i][0] == cape) {
			return capeEmote[i][1];
		}
	}
	return -1;
}[/code]

and this

case 154: if(c.getPA().wearingCape(c.playerEquipment[c.playerCape])) { c.stopMovement(); c.gfx0(c.getPA().skillcapeGfx(c.playerEquipment[c.playerCape])); c.startAnimation(c.getPA().skillcapeEmote(c.playerEquipment[c.playerCape])); } else { c.sendMessage("You must be wearing a Skillcape to do this emote."); } break;

And can anyone show me how to add the button?
Nevermind I added the button but I still need help with the emote
Please help me pm me or leave a reply!
[center]~Ezzi[/center]

Read full topic
item.source: How can I fix my skillcape emotes?
